Having proven the existence of the superstructure in
PtSn, we proceed to understand the systematic vacancy
formation in the crystal and atomic environment around
diﬀerent types of atoms. As stated before, the crystal structure
PtSn can be described as a superstructure of the
Mn-vacancies. This structure is obtained by doubling the
forced by an ordered arrangement of vacancies in the Pt
substructure of the inverse Heusler Mn

, we show the atomic environments as coordination
shells of Mn1, Mn2, Pt, Sn, and
PtSn in the asymmetric part of the unit cell.
There is no vacancy in the atomic environment of Mn1, two in
the ﬁrst coordination shell of Mn2, three in the shell of Pt, and
two in the shell of Sn. The coordination shell of

involvement of heavy elements Pt and Sn. We took advantage
